intro: Melandrium nangqenense, commonly known as the Nangqen catchfly, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is found in alpine regions. It has small, oval-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
